definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: For example, related 1L child high fever convulsion prognosis research.
sentences.chinese: 例如，有关1L童高热惊厥的预后研究。

sentences.english: Eat up high-caloric food and can't give up coke-cola.
sentences.chinese: 吃高热量的夜宵离不开可口可乐。

sentences.english: The principle and merits of which thermite is used for combustion destruction of ammunition are expatiated.
sentences.chinese: 阐述了高热剂燃烧销毁弹药的原理和优点。

sentences.english: Such heat and pressure exist only in the hot, liquid mass of molten rock deep inside the earth.
sentences.chinese: 这种高热和高压只存在于地球深处灼热的岩浆中。

sentences.english: Patients who develop trismus in association with the administration of succinylcholine may be susceptible to the subsequent development of malignant hyperthermia.
sentences.chinese: 这种牙关紧闭的患者还可以增加发生恶性高热的可能。

sentences.english: That's because calorie-dense, high-fat, processed foods tend to be less expensive than more healthy choices.
sentences.chinese: 因为高热量高脂肪加工食品要比比较健康的食品便宜。

sentences.english: He was hospitalized as a result of febrile convulsion.
sentences.chinese: 他因高热惊厥入院治疗。

sentences.english: Ventricle, pontine haemorrhage patient also has high fever, the posture can be as high as 40 ℃ .
sentences.chinese: 脑室，脑桥出血病人也有高热，体位可高达40℃。

sentences.english: There's no need to drag yourself to the coffee machine for a high-octane cup of joe.
sentences.chinese: 没有必要让自己养成用咖啡机研制高热量咖啡的习惯。

sentences.english: They"ll quickly adjust her thermostat to high heat.
sentences.chinese: 他们会很快调整自己恒温器到高热量。

sentences.english: So why do we snack, and why do we reach for the high-fat, high-sugar, high-calorie foods?
sentences.chinese: 又为什么非要选择那些高脂，高糖，高热量的食物呢？

sentences.english: Common symptoms include low fever, but sometimes high fever.
sentences.chinese: 多表现为低热，但有时也可以是高热。

sentences.english: Coffee drinks, fruit smoothies, and milkshakes are packed full of calories, fat, and loaded with sugar.
sentences.chinese: 咖啡，果汁和奶昔含有高热量和脂肪，并且富含糖分。

sentences.english: I also really enjoy drinking alcohol, including some high-calorie cocktails.
sentences.chinese: 我也非常喜欢喝酒，包括一些高热量的鸡尾酒。

sentences.english: Especially designed for under-the-hood and high heat applications.
sentences.chinese: 特别设计下，在发动机罩和高热量的申请。

sentences.english: The macroeconomy changes over to the low-heat from high fever, fluctuating range is relatively great.
sentences.chinese: 宏观经济从高热转入低迷，波动幅度较大。

definition: to have a high temperature/feverish/unable to think calmly/to emit heat
to have a high temperature (from illness)/to have a fever
to be in a state of delirium
